abstract: Exelon, the utility company, dropped a $7.53 billion offer for NRG Energy after shareholders rejected its board nominees, ending a nine-month takeover battle.
snippet: Exelon, the utility company, dropped a $7.53 billion offer for NRG Energy after shareholders rejected its board nominees, ending a nine-month takeover battle.
lead_paragraph: Exelon, the utility company, dropped a $7.53 billion offer for NRG Energy after shareholders rejected its board nominees, ending a nine-month takeover battle, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Exelon Gives Up on Bid for NRG Energy
